intro: Prionosciadium tamayoi, commonly known as the Yucatan wild carrot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, carroty scent. Prionosciadium tamayoi is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
